South Indian Breakfast: Pullattu Servings: 15 Dosa(s) An authentic recipe, sour in taste yet delicious crepe presenting from South Indian cuisine. Itâ€™s tasty, delicate and if you count on eating how many curd dosa but still you feel your stomach is empty. Because theyâ€™re so yummy and no need to count and eat, here is my formula: eat as many as you can â˜ºï¸ Letâ€™s start with Ingredients and follows Procedure Ingredients:
  • Rice - Regular variety - 1 cup - 240 gms
  • Curd/ Sour Cream/ yogurt- 2 cups ( divided)
  • Water in curd - 1/2 cup
  • Fenugreek seeds / Methi seeds - 1 tsp
  • Salt - 1 tsp
  • Oil - 2 Tb sp ( to cook dosa )
Procedure:
  • In a mixing bowl add 1 cup of raw rice, wash twice with fresh water and strain by using colander
  • In the same bowl add 1 cup curd , 1/2 cup of water in curd & Methi seeds
  • Mix well, Close with lid and let it soak for 5 hours
  • After that blend them into smooth paste without adding water
  • Take out the batter in the same bowl add one more cup of fresh curd (donâ€™t whisk) gently mix in batter
  • Close with lid & let it ferment for 8-10 hours
  • After fermentation Add salt & mix well
  • Batter is ready
  • Heat tava over medium heat, sprinkle water to check tava is hot or not
  • Wipe off with paper towel or onion
  • Pour one laddle batter and spread in circular motion
  • Apply oil & cover with lid
  • Let it cook & flip when it turns golden brown
  • Cook the other side as well & serve immediately
  • You can serve with any spicy chutney or powder
  • Happy cooking & Enjoy your day ğŸ˜Š
